department_name: Department of Food Technology and Human Nutrition

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Food Science and Technology
courses.description: This program focuses on the scientific and technological aspects of food production, processing, preservation, and safety.

course_units.title: Introduction to Food Science
course_units.description: Overview of food science principles and applications.

course_units.title: Chemistry for Food Scientists
course_units.description: Chemical principles relevant to food science.

course_units.title: Biology for Food Scientists
course_units.description: Biological principles relevant to food science.

course_units.title: Food Microbiology I
course_units.description: Basic microbiology concepts relevant to food systems.

course_units.title: Food Chemistry I
course_units.description: Chemical composition and properties of food components.

course_units.title: Food Mathematics and Statistics
course_units.description: Mathematical and statistical methods for food science applications.

course_units.title: Food Microbiology II
course_units.description: Advanced concepts in food microbiology.

course_units.title: Food Chemistry II
course_units.description: Advanced food chemistry concepts and applications.

course_units.title: Food Processing I
course_units.description: Basic principles and techniques of food processing.

course_units.title: Food Analysis
course_units.description: Methods for analyzing food composition and quality.

course_units.title: Food Processing II
course_units.description: Advanced food processing technologies and applications.

course_units.title: Food Engineering
course_units.description: Engineering principles applied to food processing operations.

course_units.title: Food Product Development
course_units.description: Principles and processes of developing new food products.

course_units.title: Food Safety and Quality Management
course_units.description: Systems and practices for ensuring food safety and quality.

course_units.title: Food Packaging
course_units.description: Materials, technologies, and systems for food packaging.

course_units.title: Food Biotechnology
course_units.description: Applications of biotechnology in food production and processing.

course_units.title: Sensory Evaluation of Foods
course_units.description: Methods for evaluating sensory attributes of foods.

course_units.title: Functional Foods
course_units.description: Foods and ingredients with potential health benefits.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Food Science
course_units.description: Research methodologies for food science and technology.

course_units.title: Food Laws and Regulations
course_units.description: Legal and regulatory frameworks for food production and marketing.

course_units.title: Food Industry Management
course_units.description: Management principles and practices in the food industry.

course_units.title: Food Science Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in food science and technology.

course_units.title: Emerging Technologies in Food Science
course_units.description: New and emerging technologies in food science and processing.

course_units.title: Professional Practice in Food Science
course_units.description: Professional and ethical aspects of food science practice.

courses.name: Bachelor of Science in Human Nutrition and Dietetics
courses.description: This program focuses on the nutritional needs of humans, the relationship between diet and health, and the management of nutritional services.

course_units.title: Introduction to Human Nutrition
course_units.description: Fundamentals of human nutrition and dietary requirements.

course_units.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology I
course_units.description: Basic structure and function of human body systems.

course_units.title: Chemistry for Nutritionists
course_units.description: Chemical principles relevant to nutrition science.

course_units.title: Human Anatomy and Physiology II
course_units.description: Advanced concepts in human anatomy and physiology.

course_units.title: Biochemistry for Nutritionists
course_units.description: Biochemical principles and processes relevant to nutrition.

course_units.title: Food Science for Nutritionists
course_units.description: Basic food science concepts for nutrition professionals.

course_units.title: Nutritional Biochemistry
course_units.description: Biochemical aspects of nutrient metabolism.

course_units.title: Nutritional Assessment
course_units.description: Methods for assessing nutritional status.

course_units.title: Nutrition Through the Life Cycle
course_units.description: Nutritional needs at different stages of the life cycle.

course_units.title: Community Nutrition
course_units.description: Nutrition issues and interventions at the community level.

course_units.title: Food Service Management
course_units.description: Management of food service operations in various settings.

course_units.title: Food Microbiology and Safety
course_units.description: Microbiological aspects of food safety for nutritionists.

course_units.title: Medical Nutrition Therapy I
course_units.description: Nutritional management of common diseases and conditions.

course_units.title: Nutrition Education and Counseling
course_units.description: Principles and techniques of nutrition education and counseling.

course_units.title: Sports Nutrition
course_units.description: Nutritional needs and strategies for athletic performance.

course_units.title: Medical Nutrition Therapy II
course_units.description: Advanced clinical nutrition and therapeutic diets.

course_units.title: Public Health Nutrition
course_units.description: Nutrition issues and interventions at the population level.

course_units.title: Nutrition Policy
course_units.description: Policy frameworks and interventions for nutrition improvement.

course_units.title: Research Methods in Nutrition
course_units.description: Research methodologies for nutrition science.

course_units.title: Functional Foods and Nutraceuticals
course_units.description: Foods and compounds with potential health benefits.

course_units.title: Nutrition in Disease Prevention
course_units.description: Role of nutrition in preventing chronic diseases.

course_units.title: Nutrition Capstone Project
course_units.description: Independent research project in nutrition science.

course_units.title: Clinical Nutrition Practicum
course_units.description: Supervised practice in clinical nutrition settings.

course_units.title: Professional Practice in Nutrition
course_units.description: Professional and ethical aspects of nutrition practice.
